abstract: China's Foreign Ministry tells Washington to address human rights problems at home and stop trying to be 'world's policeman or judge' in response to State Dept request to release civil rights lawyer Pu Zhiqiang, detained by Chinese authorities a year ago for speech-related crimes and other charges.
lead_paragraph: The State Department called on China to release Pu Zhiqiang, who was detained on May 6, 2014.

headline.main: China Rebukes U.S. Over Criticism of Civil Rights Lawyer’s Detention
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: U.S. Rebuked After Calling for Lawyer’s Release

snippet: The State Department called on China to release Pu Zhiqiang, who was detained on May 6, 2014.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
